aux_program:
% Predicates for (adjacent) cells
cell(R,C) :- setting(row(R)), setting(col(C)).
direction(left;right;up;down).
movement(R,C,R,C+1,right) :- cell(R,C), cell(R,C+1).
movement(R,C,R,C-1,left) :- cell(R,C), cell(R,C-1).
movement(R,C,R+1,C,down) :- cell(R,C), cell(R+1,C).
movement(R,C,R-1,C,up) :- cell(R,C), cell(R-1,C).
adjacent(R1,C1,R2,C2) :- direction(D), movement(R1,C1,R2,C2,D).
level_gen_program:
% The game is played on a 12x8 grid
#const w=12.
#const h=8.
#const n=w*h.
setting(grid_width(w)).
setting(grid_height(h)).
setting(row(1..H)) :- setting(grid_height(H)).
setting(col(1..W)) :- setting(grid_width(W)).

% Time bound: 100 steps
setting(time_bound(100)).

% Player is randomly placed
1 { at(R,C,player) : cell(R,C) } 1.
% Flag is randomly placed
1 { at(R,C,flag) : cell(R,C) } 1.
% Attacker is placed at the flag
at(R,C,attacker) :- at(R,C,flag).
% Player and flag/attacker are not too close
item(player;flag;attacker).
distance(D,I1,I2) :- at(R1,C1,I1), at(R2,C2,I2),
    item(I1), item(I2), I1 != I2,
    D = |R1-R2| + |C1-C2|.
:- distance(D,player,flag), D <= 3.

% Trees are placed at random
n/4 { at(R,C,tree) : cell(R,C) }.
% but not directly next to each other
:- adjacent(R1,C1,R2,C2), at(R1,C1,tree), at(R2,C2,tree).
% and not on top of the other items
:- at(R,C,player), at(R,C,tree).
:- at(R,C,flag), at(R,C,tree).
:- at(R,C,attacker), at(R,C,tree).
% The flag is reachable for the player
reachable(R,C) :- at(R,C,player).
reachable(R1,C1) :- reachable(R2,C2), adjacent(R1,C1,R2,C2), not at(R1,C1,tree).
:- cell(R,C), not at(R,C,tree), not reachable(R,C).
% No empty 2x2 squares
:- cell(R,C), cell(R+1,C+1),
    not at(R,C,tree), not at(R,C+1,tree),
    not at(R+1,C,tree), not at(R+1,C+1,tree).
% No dead ends
:- cell(R,C), not at(R,C,tree),
    { not at(R',C',tree) : adjacent(R,C,R',C') } <= 1.

% Randomize level generation
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),player). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),flag). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]
#heuristic at(RANDINT(1,8),RANDINT(1,12),tree). [10,true]

% Visualization info

player_move_program:
% Hints:
% - Wait for the attacker on a cycle somewhere, until they are near
% - then rotate so that you're closer to the flag than the attacker
% - then run for the flag
nature_program:
% Player can do at most one action per time step
invalid_move :- do(X), do(Y), X != Y.
next(R,C,player) :- invalid_move, at(R,C,player).

% Effect of move(up;down;left;right): the player moves in the appropriate direction
move_result(R2,C2) :- do(move(D)), direction(D),
    at(R1,C1,player), movement(R1,C1,R2,C2,D).
next(R,C,player) :- move_result(R,C).
next(R,C,player) :- at(R,C,player), not move_result(R',C') : cell(R',C').

% The player can't run through trees
:- next(R,C,player), at(R,C,tree).

% Flag and trees stays in place
next(R,C,flag) :- at(R,C,flag).
next(R,C,tree) :- at(R,C,tree).

%%% The attacker moves towards the player %%%

% Auxiliary predicates
max_path_length(M) :- setting(grid_width(W)), setting(grid_height(H)), M=W+H.
path_length(0..M) :- max_path_length(M).
empty(R,C) :- cell(R,C), not at(R,C,tree).

% Define possible moves for the attacker
possible_target(PR,PC) :-
    cell(PR,PC), empty(PR,PC),
    at(R,C,attacker), adjacent(R,C,PR,PC).

% Compute one that is on a shortest path to the player
reachable_within(PR,PC,PR,PC,1) :- possible_target(PR,PC).
reachable_within(PR,PC,R1,C1,I) :-
    possible_target(PR,PC), path_length(I),
    empty(R1,C1), reachable_within(PR,PC,R2,C2,I-1),
    adjacent(R1,C1,R2,C2).
select_possible_target(PR,PC) :-
    reachable_within(PR,PC,R,C,I), at(R,C,player),
    not reachable_within(PR',PC',R,C,J) :
        possible_target(PR',PC'), path_length(J), J < I.
target(R,C) :- select_possible_target(R,C),
    not select_possible_target(R',C') : cell(R',C'), (R',C') < (R,C).

% Move towards it (if there are no exceptions)
next(R,C,attacker) :- target(R,C), not attacker_grabs_at(_,_).

% Special case: the attacker catches the player if they try to swap places
attacker_grabs_at(R,C) :- next(R,C,player),
    at(R',C',player), target(R',C'), at(R,C,attacker).
next(R,C,attacker) :- attacker_grabs_at(R,C).
goal_program:
% Goal: reach the flag
win :- at(R,C,player), at(R,C,flag).

% You lose if the attacker catches you
lose(caught) :- at(R,C,player), at(R,C,attacker).

% You lose if time runs out..
lose(timeout) :- current_time(T), setting(time_bound(S)), T >= S.
